Posts.Content: Dejaboo wrote: I need some thoughts on this...Wondering if others have had this happen after surgery. Heres a little background. Had BM with expanders on May 22nd.  That was 3 weeks 2 days ago.  Last friday I was feeling pretty good.  Not great but good.  I have had a Problem with the pain since surgery.  I am taking Oxycodone everyday.  They also started me on Plavix- a Blood thinner for a Heart problem they found 2 weeks before my surgery- I will need surgery for that this fall... Last Friday I said to my daughter...Maybe monday we can do a light work out.  The weekend went ok. Monday morning I get up & go to the couch to rest.  We went for a walk around the block mid morning & I hardly made it.  I had to stop & rest & catch my breath several times.  The rest of the day I laid on the couch & shivered & sweated all day.  No Fever.  Checked it several times. The rest of the week went similar.  I got weaker each day...To wear I dont have the energy to shower or walk up stairs.  I saw my PS (another story) But I dont have any signs of infection. So Thursday I call my PCP & schedule an Appt for Friday am.  I also called my Cardios Nurse & told her my symptoms & she didnt think it had anything to do with the Plavix- but would talk to him.  Never heard back from her. My Symptoms:  Extreme-Weakness, Tired, Nausea, Shortness of Breath, Headache. Chills & Sweats off & on. The shortness of breath is something I have had for 10 years- heart problem...But it is worse then it has ever been Friday my PCP checks me out.  Does my CBC & other tests.  Couldnt pee on demand to see if there is a bladder infection. (I never can)  My CBC is normal. My Thyroid is Normal.  My Hemoglobin which was 8.4 after surgery is back to normal 12.  Great- but I was assuming I was anemic & thats why I felt like this.  She did a D-Dime test which she called me with in the afternoon.  It was  Elevated & could mean I have a Blood clot in my chest.  So I had to get to the Imaging place for a CT scan or the ER.   30 minutes before I leave for the CT.  My New teen  driver calls me & said she got in a car accident.  She is fine- the car isnt.  Grrrr.  Not part of the story- but shows you a little of the stress here. Ok So I had my CT scan.  That was very painful being flat on my back & not having good arm movement at all yet & then having to raise my arms as High as i could (I can still only get them to elbow level)  Waited there & no  blood clot.  So that was very good news.  Allowed to leave -grabbed a Bite to eat & I got to go to same teens dance recital & sit in pain & with no energy for 4 hrs.  But its her last recital & I wasnt going to miss it. But I am still at a lose for my Symptoms. Dr doesnt know what to think...She thinks I should eat better...And see her in a week if things have not gotten better. Any ideas?  Anyone else feel much worse energy wise 3+ weeks after surgery then you did 1-2 weeks after? Posts.Content: Jun 16, 2008 08:16AM - edited Jun 16, 2008 08:17AM by Dejaboo Hi Ann,   Thanks for your input.  I was wondering if anyone would catch the Oxycodone SE.  As I & my dh think that might be part of the problem...And I was kind of  trying to see if others might see that too.  My PCP doesnt have any other ideas as far as pain managment.  And my Cardio doesnt seem to give a rats *SS as to how I am doing since I started a drug for my heart. ( I know I need to find a different cardio) I did get myself off my time released Oxydodone over the weekend (I was taking 1 every 12 hrs)   I havent had any since Friday am. I am now taking 5 mg of regular Oxycodone about every 6-8 hrs.   I sometimes think I could go over 8 hrs...Then I wonder if the pain will be so bad...That it will be a while before I catch up....But really dont have a clue.  Neither my PS or PCP  are used to perscribing the drug for this long of a time. Hi Phyllis- Thanks.  Glad your friend is doing good.  Who knows when I should try to get my heart fixed.  Id say last Spring- When I tried to get them to find it!  Oh well to late for that now. Deja has been a good companion in helping me rest.  She is lazy & likes to cuddle. qsusie- how are you doing?  How did your weekend go? Pam

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2008 06:11AM Dejaboo wrote: Just wanted to update this - incase others look at it later. I have been off the Oxydone for 10 days.  I had no change (no Improvement) in my energy level or all the other terrible SEs I was having.  Infact I continued to get worse Each Day.  I stopped taking my New Heart Med 6 days ago (Plavix)  That was it.   I started to improve within 2 days...And today I am almost back to normal!!   It feels so good.  Pam

Posts.Content: Sep 27, 2009 12:15PM Dejaboo wrote: Im sorry you went through that.  it is terrible to be treated like that- Especially after a Big traumatic surgery. I experienced something similar.  It still upsets me...And it has been 16 months. I had a BLM with expanders placed.  I was wide awake when they brougt me up to my room.  They asked my Pain level- I said 9.  Did I want something for pain?  yes, I certainly needed something. 15 minutes later I asked when my pain meds were coming.  They said they paged my PS...And were waiting for him to call & tell them what they could give me.  No orders were left for after sugery?  I find that terrrible & Un professional. They paged my PS for the next 3 hrs every 15 minutes...all this time I had nothing for pain.  no Pump. No IV. Finally 3 hrs later they gave me 1 dose of Morphine...Which did nothing for me.  They gave me a 2nd dose 2 hrs later - it still did not help.  I was still at a Pain level of 8.  By Morning I was doing terrible...In a ton of pain. Someone came in & asked how I was doing- A Patient advocate?  She said they could have given me 4 doses of Morphine...Not just 2. I was given more morphine then.  But it never helped the pain.  I then switched to Percoset. I left the Hospital 2 days later with my pain still at 6. I should have filled out a Complaint.  But I didnt ever do that. Pam

Posts.Content: Jan 15, 2009 05:16PM Dejaboo wrote: I too share Beesies, Kleenex & Ailenroc Perspective too. 1-because I wanted less risk of Lymphedema & 2 Because I wanted 1 'good arm' . Granted Lympedema is possible with just a Mastectomy (no Nodes) But it is not very common. My BS wanted to do an SNB on my good side.  He also didnt want me to have a BM.  he said why take off a healthy breast.  And I countered- Why do an SNB on a Healthy breast.  I just had a Mammo & an MRI & they all show me its clean...And you want me to keep my good breast...But you also dont trust your Scans  & want to do an SNB. ( I had previously had a Lumpectomy with SNB & the SNB made my Arm & Back very Numb & extremely sore- way worse then the Lumpectomy.  At the time of my BM 7 weeks later I was worried my left arm would never be the same- and some womens arms never are.  Mine is doing very good now-10 months later) I made my choice & skipped the SNB on my good side.  My Breast was clean altough it did have ADH. When I had my Heart surgery 3 weeks ago they took my blood pressure on my Good arm Every 15 minutes for 8 hours.  I was glad to have an arm to use. It is a very hard decision....One that you can only make & know what you will feel comfortable with. Pam

Sending Prayers & Hugs to you & Your kids.  Pam ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The Rainbow Bridge Just this side of heaven is a place called Rainbow Bridge. When an animal dies that has been especially close to someone here, that pet goes to Rainbow Bridge. There are meadows and hills for all of our special friends so they can run and play together. There is plenty of food, water and sunshine, and our friends are warm and comfortable. All the animals who had been ill and old are restored to health and vigor; those who were hurt or maimed are made whole and strong again, just as we remember them in our dreams of days and times gone by. The animals are happy and content, except for one small thing; they each miss someone very special to them, who had to be left behind. They all run and play together, but the day comes when one suddenly stops and looks into the distance. His bright eyes are intent; His eager body quivers. Suddenly he begins to run from the group, flying over the green grass, his legs carrying him faster and faster. You have been spotted, and when you and your special friend finally meet, you cling together in joyous reunion, never to be parted again. The happy kisses rain upon your face; your hands again caress the beloved head, and you look once more into the trusting eyes of your pet, so long gone from your life but never absent from your heart. Then you cross Rainbow Bridge together.... Author unknown

(While we still Wait for the Cure) We all know early stage can end up having mets...But the chance is less. It did bother me that she said I am not going to die of this.  Im glad she thinks positively- I think that is a very good additude...But I also feel that makes everyone think- she really does not have ANY chance of dying from bc & we all know that isnt true I did think it was good that they pointed out that you have to be your own advocate Christinas Onco said that.   Because we know alot of women come here & their Drs have told them not to worry it is nothing- you are to young, blah, blah, blah...And we do know that they need to say No- I need to be seen & have this throughly checked out! Hopefully that will help someone catch thier cancer early...Instead of going back in a year when things would be much worse. I am still curious...She said she caught it very, very, very early- although not the earliest you can find it...So I am assuming it wasnt  DCIS only ...But possibly DCIS & micromets...or a Stage I IDC...  I felt Christina was pretty honest about her Surgery & Expanders.  If you combine what she said with the GMA interview- People who dont know...May get that it is not Immediate reconstruction. Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2008 02:16PM - edited Apr 7, 2008 02:18PM by Dejaboo I had General Anesthesia & Asked for Anti nausea drugs before surgery started. I had my Lumpectomy & SNB  6 days ago.  I dont remember the 1st recovery room which I was in for 45 min.  I dont recall being moved to recovery 2 either.  I do remember feeling ok,  I must have been in some pain- as I remember getting & asking for pain meds- they must have worked fast.   I didnt feel out of it. (but from what I remember of that day- I must have been somewhat)   I remember each of my family members coming in separately to visit me. (My dh, 2 dd, My Sister & Dad)   My daughter just told me what I said to her (As I didnt remember any of this)  I wanted Chap stick right away- she offered to put in on me & I said no & Proceded to put it all over my lips & then some.   She had flowers for me & I noticed there was Bird of Paradise in the Bouquet & Commented on them & said they were expensive.  She also said her & her sister would be going home in a Little while to walk our dog (something I wanted done)  and I told her to make sure to wipe the dogs feet after the walk- I even told her where the towels were. (was a snowy sloppy mess outside)  I do remember  telling everyone  'No Hugs' I was worried everyone would hug me I guess. I felt just a little nauseated- but not much at all- considering it had been about 20 hrs since I ate.  I had a few crackers & some Ice water & they tasted good & helped with the nausea.  I went home about 2 1/2 hrs after my Surgery. Good Luck Mary!  I was a Wreck up until that day...Then I felt more calm that day as things proceeded.

So a Lump. & then Mastectomy later can be done. (If your Next tests show that as an Option still) It is 2 surgeries ...You might feel More healed after just a Lump.   I cant say for sure...since I havent had a Mastectomy yet...But I think it will be more painful. I felt pretty good from my Lumpectomy within a week.  The SNB took about 3 weeks to feel better.   4 weeks out I felt Well. It is a Personal decision & Hard to decide sometimes...Especially when you have a shorter time frame.   And no one can tell you what to do.  They can only give you their Opinion. Good Luck with your decision, Pam

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2008 05:03PM Dejaboo wrote: Joni0702- Did you end up having the Onco test done? I just read through this thread & Found this "21 Feb 2008 09:12 AM If I'm not mistaken, the Oncotype recurrence score is based on the assumption that you will be getting tamoxifen or an AI (such as Arimidex), whichever is appropriate.  I think the Oncotype test was originally designed to tell whether women with estrogen-sensitive tumors would do well on tamoxifen alone, or would need regular chemotherapy in addition to tamoxifen.  That work is being expanded to include aromatase inhibitors (AI) instead of tamoxifen in post-menopausal women. I don't know how radiation therapy fits into your treatment formula.  The Oncotype system assumes you've had surgical removal of the tumor, either by mastectomy or by lumpectomy+irradiation.  If you had lumpectomy, you will most likely need irradiation anyway--that's pretty much automatic.  What do you think you will do, with a score of 20?  I'm waiting to hear what my score is--it was just submitted a week ago." I didnt know that the test was based for women who planned on taking Tamoxifen or an AI. Is the test not really a good indicator if you arent going to take Tamoxifen? I had a TIA (mini Stroke) 9 years ago...So I do not know if Tamoxifen would be safe for me...I am having a Bubble Echo on Monday & that should help me decide...But isnt 100% to say it would be ok.

Posts.Content: Oct 20, 2012 06:48PM Dejaboo wrote: I had 1 node removed with my Lumpectomy...I had a BLM 6 weeks later. No Rads.  MY BS said I could not get LE.  I knew that was not true.  I did take precautions.  I rested for weeks on end without lifting anything...No Vacuming - nothing...When I went back to lifting weights (which I was doing before surgery)  I worked up very slowly. No Blood pressure or IVs in my node arm (although my Idiot 1st PS OR insisted on a cuff on my left arm during my Implant Debacle- So I did have that 4 months after my BLM...But I already had the pain & swelling on my chest side...almost immediately after my BLM. I have Stage 1 Trunk LE & stage 0 left arm LE.  no arm Swelling.  My chest & sides hurt constantly.  My arm hurts alot. Some things make me wonder...Do some surgeons mess more with the nodes when they remove them...Like Jumble the nodes that are left?  Might that increase ones risk? Also pre BC.  My fingertips swelled alot when I went on walks...(although I had a hole in my heart at the time that I didnt know of & was having other severe symptoms because of it- so maybe that caused my Edema...?)  Or maybe It meant I could easily get LE...? Oh & I told my Whole family that I could never ever scrub a toilet again or I would get LE! (dh is very good about doing that)  It was my Little Joke that everyone went along with...  I never scrubbed a toilet again until this summer now I have LE- See.  I shouldnt have done that.  (certainly it doesnt matter that I am right handed- LOL)

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2009 04:02PM - edited Apr 9, 2009 04:04PM by Dejaboo While I dont have a Blood clotthing issue. 3 weeks before my BLM I found out I had a Hole in my Heart (PFO) And also an Atrial Septal Aneursym (a Weakened Heart Wall)   So That made Blood Clots a Stroke risk for me. I did not start Blood thinners before my Surgery. With Expanders Placed But Following surgery I did have 3 Heperin Shots every 8 Hrs.  2 days after leaving the Hospital I Started Plavix.   Probably different then what you are on. I was lucky & did not have any Hematoma Problems...Although I do think I lost alot of Blood during Surgery (before blood thinners) as my Hemoglobin went from 12 to 9. I healed well also. For my Exchange Surgery I was still on 81 MG Aspirin & also did not have any Bleeding problems then. Hope that helps a little. Good luck with your Surgery!  Wish I had seem your post sooner I think 4 weeks should be a good amount of time off...Depending how much you move around when singing. Pam

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2008 05:22PM Dejaboo wrote: I agree with Skyrat.  That being said my SNB/Lump was almost as bad for range of motion as my BLM (with no SNB)   The SNB Is sometimes more painful.   While some Drs will say no arms above your head- So be sure to check- not that you will be able to do that right away.  But some have resticktions for that even a few weeks out. But It is best to use your arms- Not for anything heavy.  But move them.  I had a lot of pain with my SNB & I did not move that arm because of it.  That made it much worse getting my range of motion back.   Later with my BLM I got my range of motion back almost in a month.  You will gain your range of motion back Much sooner if you use your arms & move them- dont keep them close to your sides all day.  Once you are feeling pretty good & have your Drs Approval- Stretching is very important. Good Luck, Pam

Posts.Content: Dec 14, 2012 09:51AM Dejaboo wrote: Hi IIes, Your diagnosis is similar to mine.  And there are not many of us.  In fact I think you are the 1st person I have found who had a Grade I Her2+ tumer like me.  I have seen grade 2.  Most are grade 3.  I will celebrate 5 years this March. My IDC was 1.2mm. My DCIS was 1.5cm.  I am ER+ I think it was 17%.  I am PR-. I was 45 at dx. I had a Bilateral Mastectomy- so I did not have rads.  (I did not take Tamox) When I was dx in 2008 the guidelines were still at 1cm + for Chemo & Herceptin. Get all the information you can & what you need.  Then make your decision.  Its so hard to decide what to do when you are in such a grey area.    Do what you feel is Best for You.  What will help you sleep at night. I agree with what Beesie said about the 1 thread...Alot of those women are 3-5mm tumors which is alot bigger then 1.3mm.
